ac.breakdown: Base Armor Class 10, Base Modifier +5, Dexterity +4
ac.name: ac

source.value: Pathfinder Society Quest #7: A Curious Claim

description.value: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.
The blade of this foot‑long knife curves inward and lacks a cross guard at the hilt.
This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.
Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.
A healing potion is a vial of a ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain [[/r 1d8]] Hit Points.

Neidre deals an additional [[/r 1d6 #precision ]]{1d6 precision damage} to flatfooted creatures.

When the monster Strikes a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.
On the first round of combat, creatures that haven’t acted yet are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} to Neidre.
Neidre isn’t flat-footed to hidden, undetected, or flanking creatures of her level or lower, or creatures of her level or lower using surprise attack. However, they can still help their allies flank.
